偀字的基本解释

偀
yīng
古同“英”。

偀字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yīng］
［《廣韻》於驚切，平庚，影。］
亦作“偀1”。“泱3”的被通假字。
(1)花。
(2)用以比喻文词。
(3)德才超群的人。
(4)精华。
(5)矛上的羽饰。
(6)光华，光彩。
(7)优美；美好。参见“英音”、“英聲”、“英麗”。
(8)精灵；神灵。
(9)两山相重。
(10)古国名。在今安徽省金寨县东南。
(11)通“瑛”。美玉；玉光。
(12)姓。汉有英布。见《史记·黥布列传》本传。
[②]［yāng］
［《集韻》於良切，平陽，影。］
亦作“偀2”。
草木初生的苗。

偀字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　偀； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页109第19
俗英字。

偀字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
偀字的起名意思

古同“英”。

偀
Basic explanation of words
偀
yīng
Ancient with "British".
偀
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yīng］
["Guangyun" Yu Jingqie, Ping Geng, Ying. ]
Also known as "偀1". "Yang 3" was passed falsely.
(1) Flower.
(2) It is used as a metaphor for words.
(3) People with outstanding virtue and talent.
(4) Essence.
(5) Feathers on the spear.
(6) Brilliance and brilliance.
(7) Beautiful; beautiful. See "British Voice", "British Voice", "Yingli".
(8) Elves; gods.
(9) The two mountains are heavy.
(10) Ancient country name. In the southeast of Jinzhai County, Anhui Province today.
(11) Through "Ying". Beautiful jade; jade light.
(12) Last name. There are English cloth in Chinese. See the biography of "Historical Records·Ting Bu Lie Biography".
[②]［yāng］
["Ji Yun" Yu Liangqie, Pingyang, Shadow. ]
Also known as "偀2".
The first seedlings of vegetation.
偀

[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　偀; Kangxi Strokes: 11; Page Number: Page 109 Page 19
Vulgar English words.
